channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter always full, 18th September
item.description:
The street bin is constantly overflowing, with rubbish spilling onto the pavement. This creates an unsanitary and unpleasant situation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Torrington Avenue, North Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Cleaning not happening, 18th September
item.description:
The Lynmouth Rd extension has not been street cleaned for approx 10 days. It should be cleaned Mon, Wed, Fri. This is a littering hot spot which quickly degrades if not cleaned regularly. Area has high frequency of families with small children.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osbaldeston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Guy dumped it all at the side of 148 Alnwick Road, 18th September
item.description:
Watched the guy, also have on video for proof. Dump all of this rubbish from his house and garden, to the side of his house. It looks like a complete eyesore. This happened on Sunday 14th September 2025. The location is 148 Alnwick Road. SE12.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alnwick Road, Horn Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 18th September
item.description:
Already reported about a month ago but no action has been taken yet. The pothole is still there and poses a danger to drivers and yclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 859, High Road, Whetstone, London

item.title: Dangerous exposed parts from vehicle, 18th September
item.description:
The vehicle appears to have been in an accident and has sharp, exposed parts, which pose a danger to children or cyclists, especially at night. No number plate

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friern Park, North Finchley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dismessed bike front of Screw Fix shop, 18th September
item.description:
Why are you marked "Fixed" when it is not true Thank you for reporting this matter. Your case has been fixed and is closed. State changed to: Fixed Posted by Southwark Council at 06:14 today Bike need to be collect to make space for those Who need it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 367-369, Walworth Road, Walworth, London

item.title: Debris left after fly tipping pick up, 18th September
item.description:
Received a notice this morning stating all had been picked up. These items which have been there for over a week are still there. In addition there is rotting food by one of the discarded pieces of furniture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rouel Road, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Lyndhurst Avenue AGAIN, 18th September
item.description:
Disgusting people leaving their dirty rubbish for the rats and foxes. Come on Barnet it’s time to put a camera up there or at the very least check the rubbish bags. There’s addresses in there I’ve seen them. As soon as it’s cleaned the pigs put their rubbish out again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 308, Woodhouse Road, Friern Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet
